Author: Regnar#6164
Content: BarterDEX doesn't seem to be the focus as a GUI. Just looking at the channels here we have #dev-marketmaker and #dex-hyperdex which is core of BarterDEX and then a 3rd party app that is building on the core. Building the core market maker (v2) has been the focus, not the GUI of barterDEX itself. I think the thought process here is build the engine that works really well and is easy for 3rd parties to build a GUI dApp on top as their own business.

Author: chris#0517
Content: thx I will learn more about marketmaker

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: marketmaker is based off code james wrote a long time ago. He made an entire BTC daemon in C called iguana. Marketmaker is built on that code base. IT has functions to do just about anything and can talk to just about any BTC clone. but its out dated and slow. As its multi threading was removed for stability. MM2 aims to solve all the issue found when making MM1. Any project hoping to use MM1 to build on, will just run into the same issues as HyperDEX faced. Hopefully they can figuire out how to solve some problems, and we can use that code. This is what open source is about.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
to be fair to the much maligned mm1...
it was designed to do atomic swaps and order matching, along the way SPV to be added. so it achieved more than it originally set out to do. from a cli basis, it works pretty well. any sort of multithreaded and queueing ability can be added ON TOP of mm1, which is what is required to create a performant multithreaded system. With a multithreaded overlay and queuing of requests to native mode, it would work, but then people want multithreaded and SPV servers....
that runs into the problem that SPV servers are slow, much slower as compared to native. mm1 served its purpose, it blazed the trail and showed it is possible to make a decentralized orderbook cleared via atomic swaps. the utxo issue is probably more of a hindrance than the single threaded issue for the daemon level. Remember all bitcoind rpc calls are single threaded and mm1 uses the same model

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: last i checked we do have performant multithreaded systems using bitcoind, even though bitcoind is single threaded. this should prove that even though mm1 is single threaded (at the rpc level), it is also possible to have a multithreaded view

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Hopefully Artem and team are well on their way for mm2. I‚Äôm eager to see it adopted and used regularly.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I used a multithreaded marketmaker for the streamer, works really well.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, proving the multithreaded use of mm1 is possible, it just means you need to implement the multithreading on top of mm1. given enough work it would be possible to make mm1 appear much more seamless, but mm2 will make it easier to achieve

Author: klunex#3191
Content: @actionslacks the point is that we had from 16th of march on a dex which was able to do swaps over around 95% of all existing coins. We where the only one in the space. Thats a huge advantage from a marketing perspective which we lost now. At the end its not important who invented the tech, at the end counts who brings the tech to the users. Lets say gerneral motors build a new engine, bmw copies it, make publicity and sells it.  Nobody of the car users care who build the engine. They are just happy that they have a car with an amazing engine who drives them from A to B.  In the space general motors has the recognition of the nerds, yes. But it doent harvest the fruits.
